title: Approximate controllability for 2D Euler equations
abstract:
Approximate controllability of the Euler equations is investigated by means
of a finite set of actuators. It is proven that approximate controllability
holds if we can find a saturating subset of actuators. The notion of saturating
set is relaxed when compared to previous literature, so that a weaker
sufficient condition for approximate controllability is provided. The result
holds for general bounded two-dimensional spatial domains with smooth boundary.
